New Records: South Africa's Quinton de Kock scored 74 off 40 balls
Key Match Events: South Africa set USA 195 to win
USA captain Aaron Jones: 'It's hard to take a defeat after coming so close but we did lack discipline in the bowling, at times.'
WICKET! Harmeet Singh c Stubbs b Rabada 38 (USA 167-6)
WICKET! Shayan Jahangir lbw b Shamsi 3 (USA 76-5)
WICKET! Jones c de Kock b Maharaj 0 (USA 56-3)
WICKET! Kumar c Stubbs b Rabada 8 (USA 53-2)
WICKET! Taylor c Klaasen b Rabada 24 (USA 33-1)
Anrich Nortje gets South Africa over the line, conceding just seven runs off the final over to close it out
Pre-Game Insights: USA captain Aaron Jones: 'We need to be a lot more disciplined.'
Akeal Hosein: 'The West Indies is still the ultimate goal for any young cricketer.'
Post-Match Reflections: Aidan Markram: 'Pretty happy with the performance as a whole, there were a couple of overs here and there that we need to tidy up.'
Quinton de Kock is player of the match: 'We’ve had some tricky wickets so it was nice to spend sometime in the middle today.'
USA captain Aaron Jones: 'It’s hard to take a defeat after coming so close but we did lack discipline in the bowling, at times.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa go top of Group 2.
The USA’s highest score in the tournament.
The USA’s Andries Gous blasted an unbeaten 80 from 47 balls.
The USA’s Harmeet Singh smashed 38 off 22 balls, including three sixes.
